Absci is a generative AI drug creation company on a mission to create better biologics for patients, faster. We are the company unlocking the design of new antibodies on a computer from scratch, and we're just getting started. It will take a state-of-the-art wet lab, artificial Intelligence, and above all else a team of brilliant Unlimiters working together to achieve our vision of breakthrough therapeutics at the click of a button, for everyone. We are gritty, creative, and we are pushing the limits of science in a way that no one has done before because that's how we will save lives. Join us as we redefine what's possible.Absci is a global company with a state-of-the-art lab and headquarters in the beautiful Pacific Northwest US, ten minutes from Portland, Oregon, and just an hour away from world-class alpines and rugged Pacific coastlines. Check out this short video to learn more and see how #Unlimiters are creating drugs at the speed of AI: absci.com/joinusHead of Translational ResearchRemote or Onsite (Vancouver, WA, New York, NY, or Zug, CH)As we intensify our Research and Development activities in different therapeutic areas, we are seeking a motivated and accomplished Head of Translational Research. You will be responsible for translational research across the whole value chain of R&D from target validation to proof-of-concept, collaborating extensively with all research functions, preclinical development, BD&L, and external partners. You will have a significant level of scientific research experience with cutting-edge methods and/or platforms ideally in at least one of the fields: immunology or cardiometabolic disease.Key Responsibilities: Effectively execute translational research activities for Abscis research and preclinical projectsPlan and guide in vivo pharmacology and pharmacokinetics studiesLeverage Omics data for biomarker strategy developmentCoordinate, guide, and supervise work outsourced to CROs effectively Deliver in vivo pharmacology work packages that enable asset differentiation and provide input early into the clinical development strategyDesign viable biomarker strategies for multiple portfolio projects enabling rapid and effective de-risking of clinical developmentSupport effective target evaluation and validationContribute to TPP definition and candidate selection criteriaProvide world-class scientific input into Absci research therapeutic research programs. Contribute to defining a research strategy that clearly connects with business value. Work with Senior Management to set the scientific direction and be a 'guiding intelligence' for the Drug Creation team. Inspire cross-functional connectivity and collaboration across research teams Ensure that intellectual property generated in disease biology is captured Entrepreneurial attitude and solution-oriented leadership stylePresent our science effectively at internal and external meetingsCollaborate with Absci's scientific leadership team to ensure the success of external partnerships and build a company culture that reflects Absci's core values. Qualifications:Candidates will hold a Ph.D. in the life sciences with a minimum of 15 years of experience, at least 7 in the biopharma industry, or a Master's Degree with equivalent years of experience. Experience translational pharmacology, pharmacokinetics, biomarker research, and human genetics. Proven track record of progressing one or more assets to the clinical candidate stage. Experience in planning and supervising in vivo pharmacology studies in relevant speciesExperience leading global research teams with proven successBroad background in drug discovery, disease biology, pharmacology, and omics data analysis Practical experience in effectively working with strategic collaboration partners as well as CROsTrack record of high-quality publications in peer-reviewed journals and/or relevant patent filingsPreferred:Experience using innovative technologies and modalities to advance novel drug candidates Experience in PK of biologics incl. PK/PD modeling Track record of IND enabling pharmacology studiesThe salary range for this position is $160,000 - $246,000/year. Competitive equity package applies. Pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. In addition to equity, compensation packages include a wide range of medical, dental, and vision benefits and ability to participate in our employee stock purchase plan.Absci offers highly competitive salaries and benefits, including medical, dental, vision insurance, unlimited vacation, parental leave, breakfast and lunch for onsite employees, employee assistance program, voluntary life and disability insurance, annual bonus potential, and 401(k) with a generous company match. We seek candidates who will dive into our creative company culture that's collaborative, multidisciplinary, and committed to a big vision for positive impact. We are defying conventions and innovating without boundaries. We are disrupting an industry with bold ideas and passionate pursuit of new possibilities. We are looking for original thinkers, creative scientists, and data-devoted gurus. Successful candidates will be excited to work in a dynamic environment and contribute as a key member of a project team. If this sounds good to you, we invite you to join us in our quest to redefine possible.Legal authorization to work in the United States is required. Absci is committed to equal employment opportunity and non-discrimination for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to a person's race, color, gender, age, religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, or any characteristic protected under applicable law. Absci will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law. Absci offers a dog-friendly work environment - bring your pup along for the ride.
